org.formix.btb

Class Query<I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.formix.btb.Query<I>

  • public class Query<I>
extends Object
    Instances of this class are used to define a query and it's parameters.
    Author:
    Jean-Philippe Gravel

        Parameters:

        type - The class type to be used for operations.

      • addCreatingHandler

        public void addCreatingHandler(QueryEventHandler<I> handler)
        Adds a creating handler. This handle is called before the initialization of the object.
        Parameters:
        handler - the handler to add.

      • removeCreatingHandler

        public void removeCreatingHandler(QueryEventHandler<I> handler)
        Removes a creating handler.
        Parameters:
        handler - the handler to remove.

      • getCreatingHandler

        public QueryEventHandlerSet<I> getCreatingHandler()
        Returns:
        the CreatingHandler set.

      • getPrimaryKey

        public String getPrimaryKey()
        Gets the primary key for the current query.
        Returns:
        the query primary key, if it exists or null.

      • setPrimaryKey

        public void setPrimaryKey(String value)
        Sets the primary key for the current query. Setting a null value will reset the primaryKey value to the default value set from the bridge.
        Parameters:
        value - the primary key property name.

      • getAssignationType

        public Class<I> getAssignationType()
        Gets the type that will used to set values to the class instance during operations.
        Returns:
        a Class object representing the type that will be used to set values to the class instance during operations.

      • getInstanciationType

        public Class<I> getInstanciationType()
        Gets the type that will be created during fill operations.
        Returns:
        a Class object representing the type that will be created during fill operations.

      • count

        public int count()
          throws SQLException
        Counts the number of rows that will be returned by the current query. Execute a SELECT COUNT on the underlying table using the current filters.
        Returns:
        The number of rows that will be returned by the executeFill methods.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if an error occurs during the SELECT COUNT operation.

      • execute

        public List<I> execute()
                throws SQLException
        Execute the query and returns the resulting object list.
        Returns:
        the list containing the result of the query.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if an error occurs during the query execution.

      • executeFill

        public void executeFill(Collection<? super I> col)
                 throws SQLException
        Executes the query and fills the specified list. If the collection isn't empty, contained elements will be updated.
        Parameters:
        col - the collection to be filled.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if an error occurs during the query execution.

      • onCreating

        protected <E extends I> void onCreating(QueryEvent<E> action)
        This method is called before the creation of a new object. This event gives the occasion to the user to take control of the object creation. Using this event, it's possible to seek a cache for example. Override to control the event propagation.
        Type Parameters:
        E - The type of the object to be created.
        Parameters:
        action - The action containing the event data.

      • onCreated

        protected void onCreated(QueryEvent<I> action)
        This method is called each time an object has been initialized with the current row data. Override to control the event propagation.
        Parameters:
        action - The action containing the event data.

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
